translated: Verses of the Elder Nuns .
The Group of Fives
The Elder Nun Vimalā’s Verses
“I was conceited about my beauty and form,
my charm and my fame,
and I was arrogant about my youthfulness,
and I looked down on others.
Having adorned this body,
with a pretty face and sweet talk,
I stood at the door of a brothel,
like a hunter with a snare laid out.
I seduced with my adornments,
revealing my private parts and my vulva,
I made various wiles,
boasting to many people.
Today, after walking for alms,
shaven-headed and wearing the outer robe,
sitting at the foot of a tree,
I attained the state of being free from thought.
All the bonds have been cut,
both divine and human,
having expelled all the effluents,
I am cool and quenched.”
… the elder nun Vimalā, a former prostitute …
